body: I am closing this PR because it was superseded by #436. Thanks @avanco for starting this conversation and getting it going.

@kinow next PR is just being created for `opennlp.tools.postag` package right now. Hope the "coin laundry machine" will terminate in time ;)

> @kinow next PR is just being created for `opennlp.tools.postag` package right now. Hope the "coin laundry machine" will terminate in time ;)

I'm trying to log in to JIRA from here to update both PR & JIRA. You might be able to rebase your work in a couple of minutes I think :slightly_smiling_face:
Ha! Done!! @mawiesne :+1:
This adds a `sentenceDetector` to the `NameFinderDL` to give an option to do inference over individual sentences instead of the whole text at once.

Hi!

Do you believe this fixed a valid security vulnerability? Do you need assistance with vulnerability disclosure and CVE issuance?

Most classes are `test`-classes.  The only class, which isn't in `test` is https://github.com/apache/opennlp/blob/master/opennlp-tools/src/main/java/opennlp/tools/ml/model/TwoPassDataIndexer.java - the `tmp` file is used to store some intermediate information about (event) counts and is deleted afterwards. I am not creative enough to think of an attack vector in this case. Maybe @kinow or @jzonthemtn have some thoughts on that one too?

I also don't believe this requires a CVE :+1: Security discussions are better done in the security mailing list, where others (some part of a security group) participate and there are more people to verify whether something deserves a CVE or not, and if so what's the classification, etc. Another reason why it is encouraged for users & security professionals to use the ASF security guideline - https://www.apache.org/security/

I agree with @rzo1 and @kinow.  We do appreciate your contribution, but for Apache projects, it is probably best to follow the reporting guidelines at https://www.apache.org/security/ as @kinow mentioned.
Thanks @atarora!
Thanks for your feedback, Bruno!
@jzonthemtn Feedback and review comments have all been addressed with this PR. I'd be happy if you review and/or approve the PR from your side.
@rzo1 Thanks for taking care of this!

Perhaps we would need to write some **JMH** benchmarks to see any performance impacts / drawbacks. Using ` System.currentTimeMillis()` has its own drawbacks if used for benchmarking.

If this is still a concern, we should write some **JMH** benchmarks to see, if there is a real difference (aside from JVM quirks / optimizations). Thoughts?
That's my Merry Xmas PR for 2022 🎄🌟

OPENNLP-1424

@rzo1 Introduced `@ EnabledWhenCDNAvailable `. This takes care of the above proposed check for CDN availability. Downloading test cases are now only executed when Apache's CND infrastructure is reachable. 

Other improvements -> separate issue.

@mawiesne Thanks for adding these tests!

Not for now, but later - This is a part of the code that I'm not sure is/was ever used. It's probably a good candidate for figuring out what to do with it, e.g. should it be exposed through the CLI, can we make a demo of it being used, etc.?

I tested this using the 100k English Leipzig file using the command `./opennlp LanguageDetectorConverter leipzig -sentencesDir leipzig-train/ -sentencesPerSample 5 -samplesPerLanguage 10000 > leipzig.txt`. I also tested it with an empty directory to verify the exception message. Both tests behaved as expected.

I have kept the scope to add extensions open (although not too sure if its required anymore!)
Please review and provide comments. Thanks

I think the extensions stuff can all be removed. I don't think there is anything else using them.

Looks like ExtensionLoader has a lot of occurrences so is related ExtensionNotLoadedException.
ExtensionServiceKeys doesn't have any related usages.
Thanks @atarora 👍

This looks awesome! Thanks for the level of detail on everything. I can volunteer to run the eval tests.
Thanks @atarora!

Sure. Please give it a try.

> Reviewed 63 out of 150 files smiling_face_with_tear Next time I have time I can either finish it or try running the code locally to verify it's working and its output. Thanks a lot!

Yeah - no problem. Think we have time to do it steady & slowly ;-) - I will also re-iterate about the changes soon.
@atarora FYI: This dep upgrade would help you locally with 2.1.1-RC2, as _onnxruntime_ only supports M1 Macs from version 1.12.x on. You can override it for local (eval) tests.
Note: Same idea as in `opennlp-sandbox` recently.
@kinow Thanks for your feedback & improvements.

I cloned the branch and ran the build. The output from the build is much, much cleaner so that's awesome. The eval tests are also much cleaner and easier to read. It will be nice for applications that use OpenNLP to not be flooded with print statements.

- The eval tests are running and I'll update then they're finished.
- I can also try out the bat files on Windows.

I don't have any significant issues with this. I think this is a great addition and we can always improve it down the road when necessary. We can look at how we can improve those tests that rely on the sys out.

> Thanks @rzo1 for those important changes and the work you put in! Great progress!
> 
> I have mostly minor feedback, but found one or two changes that we need to work out or find consensus on. No hard blockers, though. Needs @jzonthemtn and/or feedback by @kinow et al.

Thanks for the review. We discussed the importance of the sysouts with a :coffee: a while ago. So I am definitly in favour for **not** removing them. We should maybe replace them with trace and actually comment them in, so we have it in place if needed. Don't think we need to have it as dead code.

Regarding the variable substituion / replacement / injection: Will revice and change with https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1450

Regarding log levels: Will revise and change with
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OPENNLP-1449

I will resolve the current merge conflict now.

I just re-added `System.out` / `System.err` as `trace` (as discussed), switched to grouped 1-liner with `\t`. Fixed whitespace / tab issue ìn `bin.xml` 

I ~~will remove the DRAFT label now and~~ (already done by @mawiesne  :-)) wait for eval feedback by @jzonthemtn

@kinow / @rzo1 Note: Please close https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/OPENNLP/issues/OPENNLP-1229 as "**Won't Fix**" once the PR is merged, that is not as "Fixed" or sth.

This PR is only here to verify by adding further tests that have a reference with that issue's number.

> If you cannot close the issue as Won't Fix, I'll do when this is merged (or ping me if I forgot it and then I'll do it right away 😄 )

I can. I just wanted to document that for u guys. We should have this in mind once PR is merged.

Based on Jena's file with the same name: https://github.com/apache/jena/blob/main/.asf.yaml

This should add the labels and project description. Let me know if there are suggestions for the description & keywords :+1: 

-Bruno

>For the records: I checked Italian, yet it seems they have no special characters in their alphabet.

They should have some accents. I don't speak Italian but we had **a lot** of soap operas about Italian immigrants, and "più" always appeared in writing/speaking. Some Google Translate gives: “nor the most beautiful nor the most ugly” → “né il più bello né il più brutto” — https://it.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfabeto_italiano

> I thought of Spanish, yet could not find a valid(ated) pattern. Do you know of any proven es regex?

Good question. I'm still studying Spanish, so good opportunity for me to learn more. Give me some time and I will find one (will spend some time searching & reading about alphabet/letters/etc.).

> Couldn't find a good reference for Italian or Spanish

So better create a separate Jira issue for this and consider it an improvement? This way, we could verify and/or ask the community for support before making too many assumptions.

Failed build this is addressing: https://ci-builds.apache.org/blue/organizations/jenkins/OpenNLP%2Feval-tests/detail/eval-tests/14/pipeline/

To test:

```
wget https://nightlies.apache.org/opennlp/opennlp-data.zip
unzip opennlp-data.zip -d /tmp/
```

Then run the tests using that extracted data:

```
cd opennlp-dl
mvn test -DOPENNLP_DATA_DIR=/tmp/opennlp-data/ -Peval-tests
```
@atarora This will probably fix the eval test failures you saw when testing 2.1.1.

We should discuss switching compiler target to 17 on the dev/user list, imho.

Several OpenJDK vendors have longer support dates than announced by Oracle:

- https://adoptium.net/de/support/ (10.2024)
- https://www.azul.com/products/azul-support-roadmap/ (09.2026)

In general, I am not against this move, but would like to hear user's opinion about it.

Aside from that, I like the test enhancements.
I'm fine moving to Java 17. Probably a good idea to ask on user@ and dev@ if anyone has any valid reasons for the project to *not* change to Java 17.
